sentences: Koiralla on häntä, mutta linnulla ei.
Hänen häntänsä oli pitkä ja tuuheaa.
context: The word 'häntä' primarily means a narrow tail, typically of mammals. It can also refer to the rear end or bottom in colloquial contexts, and has various grammatical forms depending on possession and case (nominative, genitive, partitive etc.). The dictionary definitions show extensive declension for different possessors (my tail, your tail, our tail) and cases.
